str2: Woe!, alas!, uttered in grief or denunciation. A primary exclamation of grief; 'woe'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From nomos; according to law, i.e. Legal; as noun, an expert in the law.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To load, burden; pass: To be laden. From phortos; to load up, i.e. to overburden with ceremony.
A burden; the freight of a ship. Diminutive of phortos; an invoice, i.e. a task or service.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To touch lightly. From pros and psauo; to impinge, i.e. Lay a finger on.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A finger. Probably from deka; a finger.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A burden; the freight of a ship. Diminutive of phortos; an invoice, i.e. a task or service.
